content.webTitle: Motocross called off after injuries in mass pile-up

fields.headline: Motocross called off after injuries in mass pile-up
fields.bodyText: A beach motocross race drawing 800 competitors to the south-west coast was cancelled after a pile-up minutes after the start. A 16-year-old rider remained critically ill in hospital after the crash at the annual Weston Beach Race, in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset. Twenty other riders were also injured, including several with suspected broken bones, according to the St Johns Ambulance. Organisers suspended the race immediately. Held over a three-mile course of dunes and jumps, the 27-year-old race is considered one of the toughest on the motocross circuit.
